game.screen

Class ScreenManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.screen.ScreenManager

  • public final class ScreenManager
extends java.lang.Object

    The ScreenManager is a utility class for working with a single JFrame.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Julius Häger

      • createFrame

        public static void createFrame(int width,
                               int height,
                               int state,
                               java.lang.String title)
        Creates a frame with the specified mode.
        Parameters:
        width - the non full screen width of the window
        height - the non full screen height of the window
        state - the state of the window
        title - the title of the frame

      • setState

        public static void setState(int state)

        Sets the ScreenManagers current state to one of the available states.

        The available states are as follows.

        • NORMAL - Uses the user set width and height
        • FULL_SCREEN - Uses the displays default width and height

        This disposes the current window and creates a new one.
        This means that after the state is changed a new Graphics2D needs to be fetched.

        Parameters:
        state - the state to change to

      • setRes

        public static void setRes(int width,
                          int height)
        Parameters:

        height -

        public static void closeFrame()

      • getWidth

        public static int getWidth()
        Returns:
        the width depending on the current mode

      • getHeight

        public static int getHeight()
        Returns:
        the height depending on the current mode

      • getGraphics

        public static java.awt.Graphics2D getGraphics()

        Gets a up to date Graphics2D object.

        This method should be called after changing the state of the ScreenManager to receive the new Graphics2D object.

        The Graphics2D object should be disposed after use.

        Returns:
        the active Graphics2D object

      • update

        public static void update()

        Updates the ScreenManager showing the BufferStrategy.

      • getInsets

        public static java.awt.Insets getInsets()
        Returns the ScreenManager frames current insets.
        Returns:
        The current insets.
